title: How to Clear Search History on iPad + Cookies & Cache

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the cog icon.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . If you have an older iOS version, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Safari.
steps.content: Tap Safari . You may need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Tap Clear History and Website Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear History and Website Data . This is towards the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Select a timeframe.
steps.content: Select a timeframe. If you don't want to erase all data, select Last hour , Today , or Today and yesterday . Otherwise, select All history .

steps.title: Tap Clear history.
steps.content: Tap Clear history . This is the red button. Your history, including your cookies and cache , will be deleted. [1] X Research source If you want to search the web privately, consider using Incognito Mode .

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . This app icon resembles a red, green, yellow, and blue circle on a white background.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . You'll see this icon in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . This is at the top of the menu under a clock icon.

steps.title: Tap Delete Browsing Data….
steps.content: Tap Delete Browsing Data… . You can find this at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Select the time range.
steps.content: Select the time range. Tap Time range and select Last Hour , Last 24 hours , Last 7 days , Last 4 weeks , or All time . When you're finished, tap the back arrow to return to the previous page.

steps.title: Select the data you want to delete.
steps.content: Select the data you want to delete. By default, Browsing history , Cookies, site data , and Cached images and files will be selected. If you want to save any of this data, tap it to deselect it.

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data . This is at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data again.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data again. Your history will be deleted.

steps.title: Open Mozilla Firefox.
steps.content: Open Mozilla Firefox . This app's icon looks like an orange fox wrapped around a globe.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap History.
steps.content: Tap History . This is the second option.

steps.title: Tap the trashcan icon.
steps.content: Tap the trashcan icon. This is at the bottom-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Everything.
steps.content: Tap Everything . If you want to delete history from a certain time, select The Last Hour , Today , or Today and Yesterday instead. Your history will be deleted.

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com/ in your mobile browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com/ in your mobile browser. If you're logged into your Google account, your search history will be saved automatically.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture in the top-right corner. This will open a menu.

steps.title: Tap Search history.
steps.content: Tap Search history . This is underneath the More from Google Search header. You'll be redirected to your account activity.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This is the drop-down menu above your history list.

steps.title: Select a timeframe.
steps.content: Select a timeframe. You can choose: Delete today , Delete custom range , Delete all time or Auto-delete . If you selected Delete custom range , you'll need to enter a start and end date. If you select Auto-delete , you'll need to specify when to automatically delete your history. Your Google search history will be deleted.
